examples: This furnace puts out 5000 BTUs of heat .   That engine is really throwing off some heat .   Removal of heat from the liquid caused it to turn into a solid.

definitions.definition: The condition or quality of being hot .
examples: Stay out of the heat of the sun!

definitions.definition: An attribute of a spice that causes a burning sensation in the mouth.
examples: The chili sauce gave the dish heat .

definitions.definition: A period of intensity, particularly of emotion.
examples: It's easy to make bad decisions in the heat of the moment.
The heat from her family after her DUI arrest was unbearable.
The catcher called for the heat , high and tight.

definitions.definition: A condition in which a mammal is aroused sexually or where it is especially fertile and therefore eager to mate.
examples: The male canines were attracted by the female in heat .

subdefinitions.definition: In omegaverse fiction , a cyclical period in which omegas experience an intense, sometimes irresistible biological urge to mate .
The arousal or horniness of a person, likened to that of a mammal.

definitions.definition: A preliminary race, used to determine the participants in a final race.
examples: The runner had high hopes, but was out of contention after the first heat .

definitions.definition: A stage in a competition, not necessarily a sporting one; a round.
One cycle of bringing metal to maximum temperature and working it until it is too cool to work further.
examples: I can make a scroll like that in a single heat .
The children stayed indoors during this year's summer heat .

definitions.definition: Heating system; a system that raises the temperature of a room or building.
examples: I'm freezing; could you turn on the heat ?

definitions.definition: The output of a heating system.
examples: During the power outage we had no heat because the controls are electric.   Older folks like more heat than the young.

definitions.definition: A violent action unintermitted; a single effort.

examples: Whoa, that guy is rocking some serious heat .

definitions.definition: A negative reaction from the audience, especially as a heel (or bad character), or in general.

secondary_definitions: ( uncountable ) The condition or quality of being hot .
( uncountable ) An attribute of a spice that causes a burning sensation in the mouth.
( uncountable ) A period of intensity, particularly of emotion.
( uncountable ) An undesirable amount of attention.
( uncountable ) A condition in which a mammal is aroused sexually or where it is especially fertile and therefore eager to mate.
( countable ) A preliminary race, used to determine the participants in a final race.
( countable , by extension ) A stage in a competition, not necessarily a sporting one; a round.
( countable ) One cycle of bringing metal to maximum temperature and working it until it is too cool to work further.
( uncountable ) Heating system; a system that raises the temperature of a room or building.
( uncountable ) The output of a heating system.
( countable ) A violent action unintermitted; a single effort.
( uncountable , slang ) One or more firearms .
( uncountable , slang ) Stylish and valuable sneakers .
( professional wrestling slang ) A negative reaction from the audience, especially as a heel (or bad character), or in general.
